isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - ENGINE OIL TEMPERATURE (EOT) SENSOR - FUNCTION

svcproc.title: FUNCTION
svcproc.para: The Navistar engine control system includes an Engine Oil Temperature (EOT) sensor. The ECM monitors engine oil temperature via the EOT sensor signal to control fuel quantity and timing throughout the operating range of the engine. The EOT signal allows the ECM to compensate for oil viscosity variations due to temperature changes in the operating environment. This insures that adequate power and torque are available under all operating conditions.
